title: How to Make Jaffa Truffles

steps.headline: Pour boiling water over the currants in a sieve sitting over a bowl.
steps.description: This will revive them and plump them up a bit.

steps.headline: Shake the currants out onto a piece of kitchen towel.
steps.description: Roll gently to dry. If they need a little longer to dry, leave them in a warm part of the kitchen for a bit.

steps.headline: Mix the orange peel, liquid and add the currants.
Turn the cake into crumbs.
steps.description: This can be done by hand or you can simply spin the cake pieces in a blender or food processor.

steps.headline: Add the chocolate cake crumbs to the currant mixture and mix well.
Pour in the melted chocolate and mix together with the other ingredients until all are thoroughly combined.
Roll into small truffle size balls.
Place on a baking tray covered in baking paper or wax paper.
steps.description: Put in the refrigerator to set.

text: Pour boiling water over the currants in a sieve sitting over a bowl. This will revive them and plump them up a bit. Shake the currants out onto a piece of kitchen towel. Roll gently to dry. If they need a little longer to dry, leave them in a warm part of the kitchen for a bit. Mix the orange peel, liquid and add the currants.  Turn the cake into crumbs. This can be done by hand or you can simply spin the cake pieces in a blender or food processor. Add the chocolate cake crumbs to the currant mixture and mix well.  Pour in the melted chocolate and mix together with the other ingredients until all are thoroughly combined.  Roll into small truffle size balls.  Place on a baking tray covered in baking paper or wax paper. Put in the refrigerator to set. Finished.
